job description:
Janssen
Research & Development, LLC., a Johnson and Johnson Company is hiring a Scientist,
Immunobiologist within the Infectious Diseases Early Discovery team, to be
located in South San Francisco, CA.

At
the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, what matters
most is helping people live full and healthy lives. We focus on treating,
curing and preventing some of the most devastating and complex diseases of our
time. And we pursue the most promising science, wherever it might be found.

Janssen
Research & Development, LLC discovers and develops innovative medical
solutions to address important unmet medical needs in oncology, immunology,
neuroscience, infectious diseases and vaccines, and cardiovascular and
metabolic diseases. Please visit http://www.janssenrnd.com/ for more information.

We are Janssen. Our mission drives us. Our
patients inspire us. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone
in it.

We are seeking a highly motivated and
productive Scientist, Immunobiologist with a strong background in cellular
immunology and immunotherapeutic approaches to join our drug discovery efforts
for treating infectious diseases.

The ideal candidate will have experience in T-cell
biology and therapeutic vaccinology applied to chronic infectious diseases or
oncology. The candidate should be a well-organized,
team-orientated individual who
can work efficiently with limited oversight. He will design and execute projects
with significant hands-on involvement, and manage interactions with internal
and external partners.
Key responsibilities will be:
  • Establishes
    in vivo mouse models to assess cellular responses elicited by various vaccine
    strategies
  • Applies expertise to drive research projects
  • Design and development of appropriate ex vivo immunogenicity
    assays
  • Identifies
    new areas of research consistent with strategic direction
  • Reviews
    scientific work in project-related fields and areas of expertise
  • Drive collaborative research interactions across
    teams
  • Work productively as a team member as well as
    independently
  • Ensures
    the availability of adequate laboratory materials and justifies the purchase of
    new equipment
Qualifications
  • PhD in immunology with at least 1 year of
    postdoctoral research experience preferably in an industry setting is required
  • Presents
    data at in-house research forums, and at outside professional meetings, where
    applicable is preferred
  • Extensive experience in working with in vivo studies in vaccine, tumor
    immunotherapy or chronic infection models to evaluate cellular immune responses
    including: tissue collection/preparation and immune cell phenotyping/functional
    studies is preferred
  • Experience in flow cytometry (phenotypic
    profiling and intracellular cytokine staining) is required
  • Experience in basic cellular immunology assays
    such as ELISPOT, cytotoxicity and proliferation is required
  • Design/application of multiplex assays (MSD or
    Luminex) is preferred
  • Proficiency in data analysis and presentation
    tools such as GraphPad Prism, Excel. FlowJo is required
